thread.title: Tom B.

author: Tom B.
title: Tom B.
text: I was online looking for letters/numbers and was looking at the sheets where you have to take each one separately and measure out how you were going to line up the final product so that it looks straight and even and have the correct spacing between each letter/number. Then I came across DIY Lettering. I just gave them the dimensions I had to work with and they made one unit. All I had to do was peel it off and stick it on. All the hard work was done. I also liked how I could select any font, boldness, color or highlight. And, it ended up being no more expensive than if I had bought the sheets of letters/numbers and figured out how to place them myself.
